Interface GameVariant

All Known Implementing Classes:
ClassicVariant, HighStakesVariant, SpeedVariant
public interface GameVariant
Defines the contract for game variants in the Jest card game. This interface allows different rule sets and scoring mechanics to be implemented, following the Strategy design pattern for game variations.

Game variants can modify several aspects of gameplay:

  • Point calculation and multipliers
  • Number of cards dealt per round
  • Trophy card values
  • Special rules at round start and end

Available implementations:

  • ClassicVariant - Standard Jest rules with no modifications
  • SpeedVariant - Fast-paced mode with fewer cards and 1.5x points
  • HighStakesVariant - High-risk mode with 2x points and 3x trophy values
See Also:
  • Game
  • ClassicVariant
  • SpeedVariant
  • HighStakesVariant

  • Method Details

    • getName

      String getName()
      Gets the name of this game variant. Used for display and identification purposes in menus and game state.
      Returns:
      the name of the variant (e.g., "Classic", "Speed", "High Stakes")

    • getDescription

      String getDescription()
      Gets a description of this game variant. Provides players with information about the variant's special rules or features.
      Returns:
      a brief description explaining the variant's characteristics

    • calculatePoints

      int calculatePoints(Player player)
      Calculates the total points for a player according to this variant's rules. Different variants may apply different multipliers or bonuses to the base score.
      Parameters:
      player - the player whose points are being calculated
      Returns:
      the total points for the player, including any variant-specific modifications

    • getCardsPerPlayer

      int getCardsPerPlayer(int roundNumber)
      Determines the number of cards each player receives at the start of a round. Some variants may change the number of cards based on the round number.
      Parameters:
      roundNumber - the current round number (1-indexed)
      Returns:
      the number of cards each player should receive

    • applyRoundStartRules

      void applyRoundStartRules(Game game)
      Applies special rules or displays messages at the start of each round. This method is called before cards are dealt and offers are made. Variants can use this to display announcements or modify game state.
      Parameters:
      game - the current game instance, allowing access to game state

    • applyRoundEndRules

      void applyRoundEndRules(Game game)
      Applies special rules or displays messages at the end of each round. This method is called after all cards have been picked and before scoring. Variants can use this to display results or apply end-of-round bonuses.
      Parameters:
      game - the current game instance, allowing access to game state

    • hasTrophyModification

      boolean hasTrophyModification()
      Indicates whether this variant modifies trophy card calculations. Trophy cards are special high-value cards that may have different values depending on the variant.
      Returns:
      true if trophy values are modified by this variant, false otherwise

    • getTrophyMultiplier

      int getTrophyMultiplier()
      Gets the multiplier applied to trophy card values in this variant. Only relevant if hasTrophyModification() returns true.
      Returns:
      the trophy multiplier (1 for no modification, higher for increased value)
